question_sentence: A math expert figured out the best word to start your Wordle game with. What is the word?
Nominations for the 94th annual Academy Awards were announced this week. Which one of these actors was not nominated for an Oscar?
Wednesday was National Pizza Day. What is the most popular pizza topping in the United States?
Researchers at MIT have developed an innovative new material that's as strong as steel, but as light as:
Kylie Jenner gave birth to her second child with boyfriend Travis Scott! Which company did she found?
Nathan Chen earned the highest score ever in the men’s figure skating short program. What was his score?
Former ‘Jeopardy!’ contestant Amy Schneider announced she was quitting her day job. What was it?
Which two airlines announced this week that they are merging?
Nearly a week since competition began at the Beijing Olympics, Team USA won its first gold medal. Which athlete earned the win?
This week, Donovan Carrillo became the first Mexican athlete to advance to which event at the Olympics?
A leaked report by the government of which country accused China of making incursions into its territory?
evidence: The document claimed China has been trespassing in the district of Humla, in the far west of Nepal. The Chinese embassy in Kathmandu deines any encroachment

question_sentence: Talks to revive the Iran nuclear deal have resumed in which European city following a five-month hiatus?
evidence: Iran has refused to sit at the table with American diplomats, opting instead to negotiate via intermediaries

question_sentence: Exiled former citizens of which group of islands were allowed to return without British supervision for the first time?
evidence: All 2,000 inhabitants of the islands were forcibly deported, after the British government split the Chagos Islands in 1965 to allow for the construction of a US military base

question_sentence: Health officials are closely monitoring a sudden spike in Covid-19 deaths in which highly vaccinated nation?
evidence: Some 680 Israelis died from the virus last month, according to figures released by the Israeli Health Ministry

question_sentence: Which comedian is facing widespread criticism over a joke about the murders of thousands of Gypsies in the Holocaust?
evidence: The defiant comedian has vowed to ‘go down swinging’ amid the growing backlash over his joke in his Netflix Christmas special His Dark Material

question_sentence: The police chief of which Canadian city has described a ‘siege’ mentality after the arrival of truckers protesting Covid-19 rules?
evidence: The mayor of Canada’s capital city declared a state of emergency after a week of protests paralysed the city’s downtown

question_sentence: Which new member of Boris Johnson’s No. 10 team described his boss as ‘not a complete clown’ on his first day in his role?
evidence: Harri is a former journalist turned PR professional who worked as a key aide to Johnson while he was mayor of London

question_sentence: Fans have voiced fears that which long-running soap could come to an end after it was axed by its channel?
evidence: Neighbours was axed by Channel 5, leading to fears the iconic Australian soap’s almost 40-year run could come to an end

question_sentence: Waitrose has become the first UK supermarket to stock milk sourced from which unusual ingredient?
evidence: Described as ‘deliciously creamy’, the Swedish potato milk brand Dug went on sale in 220 Waitrose stores this week. Find out more on The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Russia has begun military drills with which close ally amid mounting tensions with Ukraine?
evidence: From Ukraine’s border with Belarus, ‘it is only about 130 miles (210km) down a highway to Kiev’, The Guardian reported

question_sentence: The mayor of Ottawa declared a state of emergency due to disruptive protests that have shuttered businesses and blocked roads. What are thousands of truckers protesting?
evidence: Demonstrations across Canada began on January 29 as an objection to a vaccine mandate requiring truckers entering Canada to either be fully vaccinated or face testing and quarantine requirements. Other protesters then joined to rail against lockdowns and restrictions on gatherings.

question_sentence: Queen Elizabeth II recently celebrated her Platinum Jubilee, marking how many years on the British throne?
evidence: This year marks the Queen’s 70th year on the British throne. The Queen used this historic milestone to redefine the future of the monarchy, calling for the Duchess of Cornwall to be known as Queen Camilla when Charles becomes King.

question_sentence: Which teen skiing sensation – known as the “snow princess” in China – won the Olympic gold medal in the women’s big air competition?
evidence: Chinese freestyle skier Eileen Gu won gold in the women’s big air freeski event. American-born Gu, whose mother is from China, decided to compete for Team China at the Games instead of the United States.

question_sentence: Which two airlines announced plans to merge this week?
choices: Delta Air Lines and British Airways
evidence: Spirit and Frontier Airlines on Monday announced a $6.6 billion merger, a combination of low-fare carriers that would create America’s fifth-largest airline.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives passed a short-term funding bill to avert a government shutdown next month. What would happen if a shutdown were to occur?
choices: More than 800,000 federal workers would be furloughed
National parks and museums would close to thousands of visitors
Active military personnel and veterans may not be paid
evidence: During a government shutdown, all of the above occur. Now that the House has passed the stopgap funding bill, the Senate next needs to approve it before it can be sent to President Joe Biden to be signed into law.

question_sentence: Schools across the US are becoming more supportive of lifting mask mandates, but the CDC warns it’s still too early to do so. Why is the CDC hesitant to loosen restrictions?
evidence: The head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is standing by the agency’s mask guidelines, emphasizing that now is not the time to change the recommendations. There are about 290,000 new Covid-19 cases every single day, deaths are high, and hospitalization rates are now higher than they were at the peak of the Delta surge, according to the CDC.

question_sentence: The Postal Service Reform Act is heading to the US Senate for approval. What is one of the goals of the legislation?
choices: To require retired postal employees to enroll in Medicare
Lower the age of postal workers
evidence: The sweeping bipartisan bill, if passed by the Senate, contains measures that would help save the USPS nearly $50 billion over the next decade, according to the House Oversight Committee.

question_sentence: Which popular social media platform announced a new campaign to regulate dangerous content, including harmful hoaxes and videos that promote eating disorders and hateful ideologies?
evidence: TikTok said it will strengthen efforts to regulate dangerous content with a new campaign that will ask creators to make videos that will warn viewers about dangerous acts and challenges.

question_sentence: Which movie director set a new record at the Oscars nominations ceremony this week for most films nominated for best picture?
evidence: Steven Spielberg, director of “West Side Story,” has produced a total of 11 films that have been nominated for best picture, a new record for the Oscars. The Academy Awards are set to take place on Sunday, March 27.

question_sentence: The White House approved a plan for US troops to help Americans evacuate which country due to rising tensions in the region?
evidence: The White House approved a plan presented by the Pentagon for US troops to help Americans who may try to evacuate Ukraine if Russia invades.
